Subjective: Difficulty passing hard stools x 3 months. Stools hard, difficult to pass. Bowel movements every 2-3 days. Abdominal cramps, painful to pressure. Bloating, abdomen swollen. Low appetite, eats little (pre-existing). Underweight (pre-existing), no further weight loss. No blood in stool. No change in urination. Periods regular. Olive oil tried, softened stool but not permanent solution. Sister has UC, but different symptoms. Request: Concern about seriousness, wants treatment for softer stools. Wants help with being underweight. Impact on daily life: Unpleasant bowel movements, abdominal pain, bloating.
Objective: Abdomen: Normal bowel sounds. Tympani heard on percussion, varying. Palpation: Lower left abdomen sensitive. Dampening heard on percussion lower left. No tenderness elsewhere on palpation. No tenderness in renal lodges.
Assessment: Constipation, likely secondary to Irritable Bowel Syndrome (IBS-C). Pre-existing underweight status, low appetite.
Plan:
- Prescribe Psyllium fibre sachets (e.g., Metamucil). 
- Take daily with plenty of water for 6 weeks. 
- Follow-up in 6 weeks to evaluate. 
- Safety netting: Return sooner if abdominal pain worsens, fever develops, or significant blood in stool. 
- Discuss underweight/low appetite with dietitian at next appointment.
